text.section: Prior to conducting a peer review, an individual must be approved by the Board.
In order to serve as a team captain of a system review, a peer reviewer must have and maintain ownership or management of a firm or comparable responsibility.
A peer reviewer shall have no connection to the licensee or permit holder being reviewed that might impair the peer reviewer's independence.

A peer reviewer shall:
prepare a report of findings in accordance with the standards for performing and reporting on peer reviews of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants; and
maintain the report for a period of 3 years.

A peer reviewer shall provide a copy of the report to the Board only if the licensee or permit holder being reviewed has:
been directed to take corrective action and has failed to satisfy the peer reviewer that such action has been completed in a timely manner;
received a second consecutive report indicating pass with deficiencies; or
received a failing report.
A peer reviewer shall comply with all Board regulations and directives regarding the peer review process.

The Board may revoke its approval of a peer reviewer under this section if the peer reviewer:
violates any provision of this title;
violates any regulation adopted by the Board; or
is sanctioned by any state board of accountancy or any unit of State or federal government.
